cyclone.name: OLGA
cyclone.current_location: about 320 miles SSW of Lake Charles, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating north-northeast across the north-western Gulf toward the Louisiana coast, then inland through the lower Mississippi Valley
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-central Louisiana coast near Morgan City/New Iberia

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeast Texas eastward across Louisiana, Mississippi and Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Only a low chance (â‰¤6%) of tropical-storm-force winds reaching Galveston; any winds would be brief and generally below gale force.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor tide rise possible but surge heights are not expected to exceed 3 ft along the upper Texas coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: Mostly light to moderate rain bands; heaviest rainfall axis forecast east of Galveston.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated coastal flooding of low-lying roadways at high tide; very low tornado threat this far west of the core.
